result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan R Mullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS/RESTITUTION:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence being served.
The defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original GUILTY PLEA/SENENCING Transcript (21 pages) commencing MARCH 14, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Evan R Mullen in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Evan R Mullen in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informs the court that he wishes new counsel.  The court denies request.
The state is prepared to proceed.  Defense counsel is prepared to proceed as well.  The court will pass the case.  Defendant is serving a revocation sentence.
Case recalled.  Defense counsel informs the court that the defendant now wishes to accept the state's offer.
To the charged offense:      Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Victims are present but do not wish to make statement to the court.  Impact Statement with restitution worksheet are submitted to the court.
  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 830 days time served, concurrent with any other sentence being served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay stipulated restitution in the amount of $15,237.00 to Young R C.  Court orders that restitution is to be paid prior to other court ordered financial obligations.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed, Pretrial Credit
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Evan R Mullen in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Evan R Mullen in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Alexander Klabunde-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Young C.; Jessie S. or Uncle Joe's Shoes and Sportswear

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  ADA Ballenger approved quick date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
